PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: Mrs. Charles E. McKee, 809 Gearing Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 4, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you believe that Negro communities actually choose their leaders or do they accept the leadership, which 'the powers-that-be' select and 'hand' to them?" answer reads: "I think that Negroes and whites put Negro leaders into office. A lot of the very liberal white voters vote for Negro leaders."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Mrs. Charles E. McKee wearing dark hat with netting, earrings, and houndstooth coat, standing in front of light colored pillar with storefront windows on either side, lamps on the left, and signs on the right that read "$2 Complete" and "27 x... R... Reg. Value $8 - $15"
